Line 8: Line 8:
Virtually no research has been conducted regarding the prevalance of necrophilic attraction among humans. Klaf and Brown (1958) commented that, "although necrophilia is rarely described, such fantasies are more common than is generally supposed."<ref>Klaf, Franklin S., and Brown, William (1958). "Necrophilia: Brief Review and Case Report," ''the Psychoanalytic Quarterly'', 29(143), 645-652.</ref>
Virtually no research has been conducted regarding the prevalance of necrophilic attraction among humans. Klaf and Brown (1958) commented that, "although necrophilia is rarely described, such fantasies are more common than is generally supposed."<ref>Klaf, Franklin S., and Brown, William (1958). "Necrophilia: Brief Review and Case Report," ''the Psychoanalytic Quarterly'', 29(143), 645-652.</ref>

Rosman and Resnick (1989) theorized that either of the following situations could be antecedents to necrophilia:
+
Rosman and Resnick (1989) theorized that either of the following situations could be antecedents to necrophilia:<ref>Rosman, Jonathan P., and Resnick, Phillip J. (1989). "Sexual attraction to corpses: a psychiatric review of necrophilia," ''Bulletin of the American Academy of Psychiatry and the Law'', 17, 153-163.</ref>
<blockquote>(1) The necrophile develops poor self-esteem, perhaps due in part to a significant loss; (a) He (usually male) is very fearful of rejection by women and he desires a sexual object who is incapable of rejecting him; and/or (b) He is fearful of the dead, and transforms his fear of the deadâby means of reaction formationâinto a desire for the dead.<br /> (2) He develops an exciting fantasy of sex with a corpse, sometimes after exposure to a corpse.</blockquote>
<blockquote>(1) The necrophile develops poor self-esteem, perhaps due in part to a significant loss; (a) He (usually male) is very fearful of rejection by women and he desires a sexual object who is incapable of rejecting him; and/or (b) He is fearful of the dead, and transforms his fear of the deadâby means of reaction formationâinto a desire for the dead.<br /> (2) He develops an exciting fantasy of sex with a corpse, sometimes after exposure to a corpse.</blockquote>
